Dighton- Rehoboth Regional Schools donates PPE to the Dighton and Rehoboth Fire Departments

March 31, 2020 It was with great pleasure to show our support to first responders during this unprecedented time. Dr. Anthony Azar, Superintendent of Schools proudly distributed to the Dighton Fire Chief Maguy and Rehoboth Fire Chief Baressi, the PPE inventory from the Career and Technical Education department. This distribution took place during the District’s support of the ongoing Grab n Go program for our students in need. This drive thru program is running Monday through Friday from 10:00am to 12:00pm. Thank you to our first responders for their tireless dedication to our communities.

We are saddened by the news that one of our Dighton-Rehoboth Regional High School students has fallen to gun violence. Unfortunately, we are now trying to make sense out of another life lost needlessly and ended at a remarkably young age. Our prayers and thoughts are with the victim and the victim's family at this time. I would ask, once again, that we use this tragedy as a reflective piece to ensure that it never is repeated again. Dighton-Rehoboth Regional School District will provide grief counslors to assist our community in this monumental tragedy. These counselors will be available on Thursday, June 28, 2018 at the high school beginning at 7:30 in the morning.

Dr. Anthony C. Azar
Superintendent of Schools
Dighton-Rehoboth Regional School District

DR Continues Excellence- TITAN CHALLENGE

Last week, D-R brought five teams (4 teams of 3 students and 1 team of 2 students), to compete in the Titan Business Challenge held at UMASS Dartmouth. Our students competed against teams from New Bedford High, Durfee High, Westport, Bishop Stang, Bishop Feehan, Apponequet, Greater New Bedford Voc., Dartmouth, Atlantis Charter, and more. There were a total of 59 teams competing for the honor of becoming the 2018 Titan Challenge Champions and the opportunity of winning scholarship money. The D-R team of Megan Kelley and Colby Deschenes came out on top, winning gold and the top prize of a $1000 scholarship each. Each of our teams that competed did great and had an amazing experience. Congratulations to Megan and Colby for thier first place finish in the 2018 Titan Business Challenge!!

post_text: FYI: Budget Information - Dear DRRSD Community, as one of our core values is transparency, we want to make sure that the public has the most accurate information on our proposed budget that will be presented tomorrow night. As many of you heard last week, there is a need to propose some cuts to the current budget to remain fiscally responsible to our two towns. We are making every effort to minimize the impact to programs and are using student enrollment as a key indicator. With this said, there is some misinformation currently circulating about our intention to offer Portuguese at DRRHS. We are NOT proposing to cut this program. Based on student interest and enrollment we are proposing to reduce the number of teachers who offer these courses. Additionally, we plan to continue offering Portuguese at DMS where it is currently taught in 8th grade.

Dighton-Rehoboth Regional High School Celebrates One of Their Most Successful Golf Seasons in Years

The setting for this year's Dighton-Rehoboth Regional High School Golf banquet was the beautiful Hillside Country Club, the home course of the Falcon Golf Team. The golf team annually has their banquet the day before the Veterans Day holiday and this year was no exception. However, tonight's banquet clearly had a different feel in that this years team had 18 wins and 0 losses and a SCC Championship. Another reason that this years golf banquet was special was because it marked the 40th year of DR's great coach, Mr. Bill Cute. Dr. Azar, in his remarks to the gathering said, "Mr. Cute is the absolute epitome of what and who a great coach should be: someone whom genuinely cares about the student-athlete and one that is totally committed to making each one of his students of the game, better. Tonight we salute Mr. Bill Cute as an outstanding coach and mentor to his players and we celebrate the student-athletes for a remarkable and magical year."
